definition: something that people do or cause to happen, to behave in a certain manner
details:
noun
- something that people do or cause to happen
= synonyms: deed, human action, human activity
- a legal document codifying the result of deliberations of a committee or society or legislative body
= synonyms: enactment
- a short theatrical performance that is part of a longer program
= example: a short theatrical performance that is part of a longer program
= synonyms: routine, turn, bit, number
- a subdivision of a play or opera or ballet
- a manifestation of insincerity
= example: a manifestation of insincerity
verb
- to behave in a certain manner
= example: to behave in a certain manner
= synonyms: carry, conduct, do, behave, behave, comport, deport
- to pretend to have certain qualities or state of mind
= example: to pretend to have certain qualities or state of mind
= synonyms: play
- to discharge one's duties
= example: to discharge one's duties
- to play a role or part
= example: to play a role or part
= synonyms: play
- to perform on a stage or theater
= example: to perform on a stage or theater
= synonyms: play
- to behave unnaturally or affectedly
= example: to behave unnaturally or affectedly
= synonyms: pretend, dissemble
- to perform an action
= example: to perform an action
= synonyms: move
- to have an effect or outcome
= example: to have an effect or outcome
= synonyms: work
- to be suitable for theatrical performance
= example: to be suitable for theatrical performance
